name: Lost for Words! 16 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"Ah, I should have known it from the very start
This girl will leave me with a broken heart
Now listen people what I'm telling you
A-keep away from-a runaround ______."

What is this dangerous girl's name?
questions.explanation:
Sue.

	"Runaround Sue" was a hit for Dion, real name Dion DiMucci, in 1961.A US #1 the song peaked at #11 in the UK.

questions.text:
"You picked a fine time to leave me ______
With four hungry children and a crop in the field."

Who's left Kenny Rogers with the kids?
questions.explanation:
Lucille.

	Kenny Rogers hit the charts with the sad story of "Lucille" in 1977. Rogers, a former New Christie Minstrel, has more than twenty US Gold Albums.

questions.text:
"Oh, I love my ______ child 
She got the way to make me happy 
You and me, we go in style 
Cracklin' ______, you're a store bought woman."

What is this store bought woman's name?
questions.explanation:
Rosie.

	"Cracklin' Rosie" was both written and sung by Neil Diamond. This 1970 US chart topper peaked at #3 in the UK. The second blank in the above question gives her full name (Rose) rather than her nickname.

questions.text:
"Little ditty about Jack and ______
Two American kids growin' up in the heartland
Jack, he's gonna be a football star
______ débutante backseat of Jacky's car."

Who is Jack's partner?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	John Cougar Mellencamp charted with these lyrics from "Jack and Diane" in 1982. A US #1 "Jack and Diane" only managed #25 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Jimmy, Jimmy, oh! Jimmy ______, when are you coming back?
My arms are missing you, my lips feel the same way too."

It should be easy to place the missing name in this Martha & The Vandellas classic.
questions.explanation:
Mack.

	These lyrics come from "Jimmy Mack" by Martha (Reeves) and The Vandellas. This Motown classic was released in 1967.

questions.text:
"______ is traveling tonight on a plane 
I can see the red tail lights heading for Spain 
Oh and I can see ______ waving goodbye 
God it looks like ______, must be the clouds in my eyes."

Who's off on a flight here?
questions.explanation:
Daniel.

	"Daniel" was a hit for flamboyant singer Elton John in 1973. Elton, real name Reginald Dwight, co-wrote the song with Bernie Taupin. "Daniel" made it to #4 in the UK charts.

questions.text:
"Get back, get back. 
Get back to where you once belonged. 
Get back ______ - Go home 
Get back, get back."

Who's being told to "Get Back" in this Beatles lyric?
questions.explanation:
Jojo.

	The Beatles charted with these lyrics from "Get Back" in 1969. The single was a chart topper on both sides of the Atlantic.

questions.text:
"Goodbye ______ Tuesday 
Who could hang a name on you? 
When you change with every new day 
Still I'm gonna miss you."

Who's going to be missed by the Rolling Stones in this song?
questions.explanation:
Ruby.

	"Ruby Tuesday" was written by Mick Jagger and Keith Richards. This song has charted in the UK. for the Rolling Stones in 1967, Melanie (Safka) in 1970 and Rod Stewart in 1993.

questions.text:
"Wake up, little ______, wake up 
The movie wasn't so hot, it didn't have much of a plot 
We fell asleep, our goose is cooked, our reputation is shot 
Wake up little ______."

Which young lady is dozing-off in this song?
questions.explanation:
Susie.

	The Everly Brothers, Phil and Don, charted with "Wake Up Little Susie" in 1957. A US chart topper the single peaked at #2 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Sweet little ______, you'll know her if you see her 
Blue eyes and a ponytail 
Her cheeks are rosy, she looks a little nosey 
Man, this little girl is fine."

Which of these names fits the above description?
questions.explanation:
Sheila.

	These lyrics come from the 1962 hit "Sheila". The song, written and sung by Tommy Roe, topped the US charts peaking at #3 in the UK.
